questions.question: What is the main focus of the study described in the paper with DOI 10.1016/j.cej.2020.127183?
questions.answer: The main focus of the study is to understand how pore surface fluorination influences light hydrocarbon separation in metal-organic frameworks (MOFs).

questions.question: What are the names of the three Cu(II)-MOFs discussed in the study and their respective synthesis temperatures?
questions.answer: The three Cu(II)-MOFs discussed are Cu-INA, Cu-FINA-1, and Cu-FINA-2. Cu-INA was synthesized at 120°C, Cu-FINA-1 at 100°C, and Cu-FINA-2 at 90°C.

questions.question: How does the introduction of fluorine atoms into the pore surfaces of MOFs affect their gas adsorption and separation performances?
questions.answer: The introduction of fluorine atoms into the pore surfaces of MOFs enhances the separation performances toward alkyne/alkene mixtures by providing polarizable adsorption sites and tailored pore sizes, leading to an increase in C2H2 selectivity in C2H2/C2H4 and C3H4 selectivity in C3H4/C3H6 separations.

questions.question: What computational method was used to gain insights into the adsorption/separation processes of the fluorinated MOFs?
questions.answer: Dispersion-corrected density functional theory (DFT-D) calculations were conducted to gain insights into the adsorption/separation processes of the fluorinated MOFs.

questions.question: Which Cu(II)-MOF showed the highest separation efficiency for C2H2/C2H4 mixture in dynamic conditions?
questions.answer: Cu-FINA-1 showed the highest separation efficiency for C2H2/C2H4 mixture in dynamic conditions.

questions.question: True or False: The study found that the pore surface fluorination in MOFs does not significantly impact the adsorption enthalpy for gas molecules.
What was the main challenge in designing MOF adsorbents for light hydrocarbon separations according to the study?
questions.answer: The main challenge was the complexity in the separation processes and the relative lack of structure-separation relationship information, making it difficult to design MOF adsorbents rationally according to industrial demands.

questions.question: True or False: Cu-FINA-2 exhibits a higher C3H4/C3H6 IAST selectivity compared to Cu-FINA-1 and Cu-INA.
What role do polar F sites within the confined pores of Cu-FINA-1 and Cu-FINA-2 play in gas adsorption?
questions.answer: The polar F sites within the confined pores of Cu-FINA-1 and Cu-FINA-2 interact with gas adsorbates through C-H···F hydrogen bonds, contributing to the enhanced separation selectivity.

questions.question: True or False: The study concludes that the enhancement of separation selectivities in fluorinated MOFs is mainly attributed to the optimization of pore size and roughness of the diffusion path.
